title: Are the reasons given behind the lower level of salinity around the poles, like rain and ice melting, really convincing or scientifically sufficient? Could there be other unknown reasons? - Quora

response.answer_text: It could also have to do with ocean currents in both polar areas are much slower moving that in the other oceans and that has to do with the fact that warmer water must move around land masses to mix. Plus the fact that both polar regions have large amounts of freshwater that, as noted, reduces the salinity as it flows into the cold waters.
Where fresh water mixes with salt water it alters the Molarity (density) of the salt Water making it less dense.
